name: places/ChIJQ7heHBj2wokR8RgbGMa3dpk
formattedAddress: 301 Cathedral Pkwy #1, New York, NY 10026, USA
adrFormatAddress: 301 Cathedral Pkwy #1, New York, NY 10026, USA

originalText.text: The women behind the counter are seemingly purposefully rude and unhelpful.  They won’t tell you where to place your merchandise and expect you to move it when they finally decide to help you.

text.text: The women behind the counter are seemingly purposefully rude and unhelpful.  They won’t tell you where to place your merchandise and expect you to move it when they finally decide to help you.

originalText.text: We used to buy wine at Cathedral Wine at least once a week. Yesterday my wife bought two bottles I didn't like, so today I went there with her credit card and asked to exchange them for another two bottles. The guy behind the counter refused to do it. No explanation, nothing, just could not be bothered. I dislike leaving negative reviews to small neighborhood businesses, but the way they treated a regular customer just strikes a nerve. I won't be spending my money there anymore. The Winery on 116 & Frederick Douglass offers a far superior wine buying experience.

originalText.text:
I dislike leaving poor reviews, I am a small business owner and recognize that everyone has a bad day. However this is perhaps my 3rd or 4th bad experience with this store and it is such a shame. The store is beautiful and prestine, however the customer service is just HORRIBLE. The ladies at the desk could care less about their customers, they are usually laughing and talking amongst themselves, not paying attention to your request then blaming you for not telling them earlier. I have also had trouble on numerous occasions trying to order from the store even though I live only one Avenue block away. They always give me a hard time and the last time refused to deliver.. Fine, I now walk the block myself. But still.. It is though they do not want my business even though I come to the store proximately twice a week. Additionally they never seem to recognize me even though I have been coming there for they’ve been open.

I think I will go to the store on Lenox even though it is not as nice of store.. however at least I am treated kindly by the clerk..   This place makes you feel so uncomfortable, you don’t want to come back and I don’t think I ever will.

originalText.text:
BEWARE

They will add a dollar to pay by card, and they will try to add it even if you pay by cash too, so if you have to go here always *always* check your bill before paying.

NB: bottles here are already more expensive than in other local stores, everything is apparently marked up as a policy.

Walk a couple of blocks or get ripped off - great store on 116, The Winery - plenty of other local options that don’t do this.

originalText.text:
They will add on a credit card fee even if you’re about to pay with cash.  I caught the cashier at it this evening and he removed the excess charge.

Price labels on the shelves do not correspond to the actual prices of the bottles.  What you may think is an $11 bottle of wine may actually turn out to be $15 or $16. Exercise caution when buying in the store.
